page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY RAFFORD AREA
page.content: Blervie Castle was built about the end of the 14th century.Much of the castle was demolished and the stones were used for the present mansion.The castle is now represented by the 5 storey tower which commands a view over 7 counties. There is a war memorial which was erected in 1919 and contains 11 names of soldiers killed in the Great war and 20 who were killed in the second World War. The only ancient monumentin our area is Templestones.Four stones form a rectangle 3.4m by 2.7m. This is thought to be an ancient burial ground dating back to the stone age. Lady Duff's tomb is situated on the ground of Marcassie farm,Rafford.It is dated 1808 and contains the remains of the wife of the Honourable Lewis Duff an important land owner in the area.
